metadata.Title: CVE-2021-22569 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue in protobuf-java allowed the interleaving of com.google.protobuf.UnknownFieldSet fields in such a way that would be processed out of order. A small malicious payload can occupy the parser for several minutes by creating large numbers of short-lived objects that cause frequent, repeated pauses. We recommend upgrading libraries beyond the vulnerable versions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

elpa-protobuf-mode - 3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1
libprotobuf-java - 3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1
libprotobuf-lite23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1
libprotobuf23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1
libprotoc23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1
protobuf-compiler - 3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1
python3-protobuf - 3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1
ruby-google-protobuf - 3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: protobuf package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.12.4-1ubuntu7.22.04.1').
